verses.verse: Concerning the Ammonites<WH1121>, thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>; Has Israel<WH3478> no sons<WH1121>? has he no heir<WH3423>? why then does their king<WH4428> inherit<WH3423> Gad<WH1410>, and his people<WH5971> live<WH3427> in his cities<WH5892>?

Concerning Damascus<WH1834>. Hamath<WH2574> is confounded<WH954>, and Arpad<WH774>: for they have heard<WH8085> evil<WH7451> news<WH8052>: they are fainthearted<WH4127>; there is sorrow<WH1674> on the sea<WH3220>; it cannot<WH3201> be quiet<WH8252>.

Concerning Kedar<WH6938>, and concerning the kingdoms<WH4467> of Hazor<WH2674>, which Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> shall strike<WH5221>, thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>; Arise<WH6965> you<WH5927>, go up to Kedar<WH6938>, and plunder<WH7703> the men<WH1121> of the east<WH6924>.

The word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> that came to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> against Elam<WH5867> in the beginning<WH7225> of the reign<WH4438> of Zedekiah<WH6667> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>, saying<WH559>,
